Server

Class webServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • Server.webServer

  • public class webServer
extends Object
    This contains all of the functions necessary for running the webserver. It also specifies all of the pages that can be accessed. The default port is 4567. Sites to look at:

    127.0.0.1:4567/index This leads a random page with a bunch of stuff I was experimenting with, particularly dynamic images.

    127.0.0.1:4567/stega The result of the project is here. This contains a dynamically generated image with a hidden IP address in it. If this image is saved as a PNG (jpegs are lossy), one can run it through the included decoder to determine what the address the host who saved the file is.

    The images are located in /Proxy/srd/main/resources The templates for freemarker are located in /Proxy/src/main/resources/spark/template/freemarker

      Constructors

      webServer()
      The default constructor.
      webServer(int Port)
      The alternate constructor if you would like to set a specific port to bind the server on

    • Constructor Detail

      • webServer

        public webServer()
        The default constructor. Binds the server to port 4567

      • webServer

        public webServer(int Port)
        The alternate constructor if you would like to set a specific port to bind the server on
        Parameters:
        Port - An integer specifying where the server should bind to.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public boolean start()
        Launches the server
        Returns:
        This doesn't return anything

      • imgToBase64

        public String imgToBase64(String source)
        This function isn't actually useful in this context. It encodes an image to Base64 so it can be sent easily over HTTP without multiple requests. It works for dynamic modification of the images but is difficult to save the file once it is loaded client side.
        Parameters:
        source - The filepath to the image to be sent to the client
        Returns:
        Returns a string that can be decoded into an image
